intro: Reseda barrelieri, commonly known as the Barrelier's reseda, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers, which are usually pink or white, bloom in late spring or early summer. Reseda barrelieri is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands.
